es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api

Class InfrastructureManagerApiClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.upv.i3m.grycap.im.api.InfrastructureManagerApiClient

  • public class InfrastructureManagerApiClient
extends Object
    This class offers the user an API to communicate with the Infrastructure Manager

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InfrastructureManagerApiClient(String targetUrl, String authFilePath)
      Create a new IM client

        public ServiceResponse getVMInfo(String infId,
                        String vmId)
                          throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Return information about the virtual machine with ID vmId associated to the infrastructure with ID infId.
        The returned string is in RADL format.
        See more the details of the output in GetVMInfo
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        vmId - : virtual machine id
        Returns:
        : RADL file
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • destroyInfrastructure

        public ServiceResponse destroyInfrastructure(String infId)
                                      throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Undeploy the virtual machines associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        Returns:
        : True if undeploy successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • createInfrastructure

        public ServiceResponse createInfrastructure(String radlFile)
                                     throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Create and configure an infrastructure with the requirements specified in the RADL document of the body contents.
        If success, it is returned the URI of the new infrastructure.
        Parameters:
        radlFile - : file with the virtual machine properties and configuration
        Returns:
        : URI of the new infrastructure
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • addResource

        public ServiceResponse addResource(String infId,
                          String radlFile,
                          boolean... context)
                            throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Add the resources specified in the body contents to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'. The RADL restrictions are the same as in RPC-XML AddResource
        If success, it is returned a list of URIs of the new virtual machines.
        The context parameter is optional and is a flag to specify if the contextualization step will be launched just after the VM addition.
        As default the contextualization flag is set to True.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        radlFile - : file with the virtual machine properties and configuration
        context - : flag to specify if the contextualization step will be launched just after the VM addition
        Returns:
        : list of URIs of the new virtual machines
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        IncorrectContextInputException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • removeResource

        public ServiceResponse removeResource(String infId,
                             String vmId,
                             boolean... context)
                               throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Undeploy the virtual machine with ID vmId associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'.
        The context parameter is optional and is a flag to specify if the contextualization step will be launched just after the VM addition.
        As default the contextualization flag is set to True.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        vmId - : virtual machine id
        context - : flag to specify if the contextualization step will be launched just after the VM addition
        Returns:
        : True if undeploy successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • stopInfrastructure

        public ServiceResponse stopInfrastructure(String infId)
                                   throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Stop (but do not undeploy) all the virtual machines associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'. They can be resumed by the 'startInfrastructure' method.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        Returns:
        : True if stopping the infrastructure is successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • startInfrastructure

        public ServiceResponse startInfrastructure(String infId)
                                    throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Resume all the virtual machines associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId', previously stopped with the 'stopInfrastructure' method.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        Returns:
        : True if starting the infrastructure is successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • stopVM

        public ServiceResponse stopVM(String infId,
                     String vmId)
                       throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Perform the 'stop' action in the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        vmId - : virtual machine id
        Returns:
        : True if stopping the vm is successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • startVM

        public ServiceResponse startVM(String infId,
                      String vmId)
                        throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Perform the 'start' action in the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' associated to the infrastructure with ID 'infId'.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        vmId - : virtual machine id
        Returns:
        : True if starting the vm is successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • alterVM

        public ServiceResponse alterVM(String infId,
                      String vmId,
                      String radlFile)
                        throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Change the features of the virtual machine with ID 'vmId' in the infrastructure with with ID 'infId', specified by the RADL document specified in the body contents.
        Return a RADL with information about the virtual machine, like GetVMInfo.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        vmId - : virtual machine id
        radlFile - : file with the virtual machine properties and configuration
        Returns:
        : RADL with information about the virtual machine modified
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • reconfigure

        public ServiceResponse reconfigure(String infId)
                            throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Perform the reconfigure action in all the virtual machines in the the infrastructure with ID 'infID'.
        This method starts the contextualization process again.
        To reconfigure the VMs see the reconfigure methods that include the 'radl' parameter.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidAuthFileException
        AuthFileNotFoundException

      • reconfigure

        public ServiceResponse reconfigure(String infId,
                          String radlFile,
                          int... vmList)
                            throws AuthFileNotFoundException
        Perform the reconfigure action in all the virtual machines in the the infrastructure with ID 'infID.' It updates the configuration of the infrastructure as indicated in the 'radlFile'. The RADL restrictions are the same as in RPC-XML Reconfigure
        If no RADL are specified, the contextualization process is started again. The 'vmList' parameter is optional and is a comma separated array of IDs of the VMs to reconfigure. If not specified all the VMs will be reconfigured.
        Parameters:
        infId - : infrastructure id
        radlFile - : file with the infrastructure properties and configuration
        vmList - : comma separated list of IDs of the VMs to reconfigure
        Returns:
        Throws:
        AuthFileNotFoundException
        javax.ws.rs.core.UriBuilderException
        IllegalArgumentException
